intro: Ornithidium lineare, commonly known as the linear orchid, is a small, terrestrial orchid native to South America. It features delicate, linear leaves and produces slender, white or pale green flowers with a distinctive, elongated shape. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its flowers are often pollinated by small flies and beetles due to their subtle coloration and scent. Ornithidium lineare is noted for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
